sentences: Ema ja isa on lõuna ajal kodus.
context: The Estonian word 'isa' means father or dad. It's a masculine noun referring to one's male parent. In the examples provided, I've shown different cases: nominative case 'isa', genitive case 'isa', and partitive case 'isat'. The word follows Estonian grammar rules with declension changes depending on its grammatical function in the sentence.
